keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
keywords.name: organizations

byline.original: By DIONNE SEARCEY, ERIC SCHMITT and RUKMINI CALLIMACHI
byline.contributor: Dionne Searcey reported from Dakar, Eric Schmitt from Washington and Rukmini Callimachi from New York.

lead_paragraph: Only a few years after French troops scattered its fighters, Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb has regrouped and extended its reach in three nations.

headline.print_headline: Qaeda Branch in West Africa Is Making a Lethal Comeback
headline.main: Al Qaeda’s Branch in Africa Makes a Lethal Comeback

snippet: Only a few years after French troops scattered its fighters, Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb has regrouped and extended its reach in three nations.
abstract: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb, West African branch of Islamic terrorist group, has regrouped and extended its reach just four years after French troops were thought to deal group lethal blow; large-scale terrorist attacks in Ivory Coast, Burkina Faso and Mali have put region on edge, hurt economies and stressed international efforts to combat group.
